sk.upjs.gursky.bplustree
Interface BPKey<K>

Type Parameters:
K - The implementing class itself
All Superinterfaces:
Comparable<K>, Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
BPKeyDouble, BPKeyInt, BPKeyLong, BPKeyString, BPKeyString50
public interface BPKey<K>
extends Comparable<K>, Serializable

In BPTree entries are organized and sorted by key values first. Every key value must be able to serialize itself to the ByteBuffer. Every key in the tree must have equal size, i.e. the method getSize() must return a constant equal value for all keys in a tree. Two keys must be comparable to manage a sorted character of the B+tree structure.

Version:
1.0, February 5th 2009
Author:
Peter Gursky

Method is used to load information about instance variable(s) of the key from the current position of the ByteBuffer.

Parameters:

save

void save(ByteBuffer bb)
Method is used to save information about instance variable(s) of the key to the current position of the ByteBuffer.

Parameters:
bb - buffer to write to

getSize

int getSize()
Method returns the maximal number of bytes needed to store a key value to a ByteBuffer. Method must return a constant (final static) value for all instances. For example, if the key is of type int, this method should always return 4. If the size of the keys differs between instances, this value stands for the maximal size.

Returns:
size needed to store this type of the key.
